page.title: 10THE BAKER'S ALMS HOUSES.
page.content: The present{Almshouses }on this site, adjoining Lea Bridge Road in Leyton, were built in 1857 for the Pensioners of the Company of London Master Bakers. The design by T.Knightley was for 50 villas,each having 2 storeys and a small private garden at its rear were to house a man,a woman or a couple who were to be partly cared for by a resident warden.The buildings ,on 3 sides of a square,face inwards on a circular communal garden and access road. In 1973 the G.L.C. bought the site for a road widening scheme,which was later abandoned.The houses were then refurbished and converted into one bedroomed flats. As a result of this the Almshouses once again serve as homes for pensioners. A beautiful landmark in Leyton.
